1.text: Wisdom hath built her house, she hath hewn out her seven pillars:

2.text: She hath killed her beasts; she hath mingled her wine; she hath also furnished her table.

3.text: She hath sent forth her maidens: she crieth upon the highest places of the city,

4.text: Whoever is simple, let him turn in hither: as for him that wanteth understanding, she saith to him,

5.text: Come, eat of my bread, and drink of the wine which I have mingled.

6.text: Forsake the foolish, and live; and go in the way of understanding.

7.text: He that reproveth a scorner, getteth to himself shame: and he that rebuketh a wicked man getteth himself a blot.

8.text: Reprove not a scorner, lest he shall hate thee: rebuke a wise man, and he will love thee.

9.text: Give instruction to a wise man, and he will be yet wiser: teach a just man, and he will increase in learning.

10.text: The fear of the LORD is the beginning of wisdom: and the knowledge of the holy is understanding.

11.text: For by me thy days shall be multiplied, and the years of thy life shall be increased.

12.text: If thou art wise, thou shalt be wise for thyself: but if thou scornest, thou alone shalt bear it.

13.text: A foolish woman is clamorous: she is simple, and knoweth nothing.

14.text: For she sitteth at the door of her house, on a seat in the high places of the city,

15.text: To call passengers who go right on their ways:

16.text: Whoever is simple, let him turn in hither: and as for him that wanteth understanding, she saith to him,

17.text: Stolen waters are sweet, and bread eaten in secret is pleasant.

18.text: But he knoweth not that the dead are there; and that her guests are in the depths of hell.
